results.title: Running and mobility
results.creator_credit: Slater Sound Studios, South Australian Film Corporation, Bruce Moir, Nicholas Cockram and Brian Hannant
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conditioning for Sport”.
Gives an insight into the specific exercises, training and conditioning techniques necessary for proficiency in running. Describes how the body adjusts to new levels of achievement with the proper training. (Photographer, David Foreman ; Script, Terry Jennings ; Editor, Andrew Prowse ; Sound, Rod Pascoe).

results.title: Running
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976 Olympic Films”.
Compiled as a visual aid to coaching and physical education, this film collects silent, slow-motion footage of the men’s track events at the 1976 Montreal Olympics.

results.title: Runner
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Don Owen
results.brief_description: In an age when most North American boys have their eyes on a car, there are a few who choose the older ideal of fleetness of foot. Such a one is Bruce Kidd, Toronto long-distance runner, winner of national and international honors. Oblivious of the clapping crowds and the flash of cameras, he knows full well that in the long run it is the cold stopwatch that tells the truth. Commentary written by W. H. Auden.

results.title: Rune stones in Sweden
results.brief_description: Rune stones are one of the interesting relics of the Viking Age to be found in many parts of central and southern Sweden. The oldest Runic inscription discovered up to now, is to be found on a spearhead from the 3rd Century AD. Sparlosastenen and Rokstenen are amongst the oldest Rune stones in Sweden. The text of Sparlosastenen is difficult to interpret but the pictures still tell us a good deal about the ancient Scandinavian’s conception of things. These and other Rune stones tell us much about the Viking way of life.

results.title: Runaway bride
results.creator_credit: Interscope Commmunication, Lakeshore Entertainment, Touchstone Pictures, Robert W. Cort, Ted Field, Scott Kroopf, Tom Rosenberg and Garry Marshall
results.brief_description: Richard Gere is Ike Graham, a big-city newspaper columnist who causes an uproar with an unflattering and wildly erroneous story about small-town girl Maggie Carpenter. Julia Roberts is Maggie, whose reputation for leaving prospective husbands at the altar has made her a local legend. Gere is assigned by his editor (Hector Elizondo) to write a follow-up story on Maggie, and he tracks her down to her home town in Maryland where she is spending time with her family and preparing to give marriage another try. While Ike plans to prove he was right about Maggie, and Maggie plans to even the score with Ike, nothing prepares them for the sparks that fly when they meet! Cast also includes Joan Cusack, Rita Wilson, Paul Dooley, Christopher Meloni.

results.title: Run Rebecca, run! (K)
results.creator_credit: Independent Productions (AU), Brendon Lunney and Peter Maxwell
results.brief_description: While on a photographic expedition Rebecca Porter finds herself on Lonesome Island where she meets Manuel, a South American ship’s deserter who missed the recently announced amnesty and who is now in fear of arrest and deportation. Manuel tries to stop Rebecca leaving the Island until the Police have stopped looking for him but Rebecca has other plans. Starring Henri Szeps, John Stanton, Mary Ann Severne, Adam Garnett and Simone Buchanan. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Run Rebecca Run (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Independent Productions (AU), Brendon Lunney and Peter Maxwell
results.brief_description: When the local newspaper offers a fully equipped bicycle to the young person submitting the best photograph of their pet with a suitable caption, Rebecca Porter quickly goes into the National Park with her cockatoo, Fancy. The photographic expedition goes well until a sandbank, on which she is posing Fancy, is threatened by the rapidly rising tide. While she is stranded, she meets Manuel, a ship’s deserter, who faces deportation. When Rebecca is eventually rescued, it is too late to enter the competition.

results.title: Run nickel run: the making of a movie
results.creator_credit: TVW Channel Seven and Syd Donovan
results.brief_description: Documents the making of the feature film “Nickel Queen”. This Australian production directed by John McCallum and starring Googie Withers told the story of the widowed owner of the Mirribilli pub’s sudden turn of fortune during the mining boom in Western Australia. Includes a scene with John Laws as a hippie.

results.title: Run Lola run = Lola Rennt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Arte, BMI, Bavaria Film, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, German Independents, NRW, WDR, X filme creative Pool, Stefan Arndt and Tom Tykwer
results.brief_description: Time is running out for Lola (Franka Potente). She’s just received a frantic phone call from her boyfriend Manni (Moritz Bleibtreu), who’s lost a small fortune in cash belonging to his Mob boss. Now she has to run for his life, to try and come up with the money before Manni pays the ultimate price for his mistake. Using a destiny device, the story begins anew with different outcomes. Other cinematic techniques which add to the breakneck pace and excitement of this innovative thriller include jump cuts, whip pans, slow and fast motion, split-screen, intercut colour and black and white, segment titles and animation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arte, BMI, Bavaria Film, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, German Independents, NRW, WDR, X filme creative Pool, Stefan Arndt and Tom Tykwer

results.title: Run for your life
results.brief_description: Examines the reasons why runners of all ages have opted for this form of exercise. Interviews with joggers and physicians point out the psychological and medical benefits of running and stress the importance of cardiovascular health in today’s urban, sedentary lifestyle. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.
